title: Group of juveniles kick man into moving train at Back Bay Station
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 27-year-old man was injured after being kicked into a moving Orange Line train at Back Bay Station.
The incident occurred around 6:46 p.m. when a dispute with juveniles escalated into a physical altercation.
Transit Police are investigating the attack; the juveniles fled the scene and no arrests have been made.

title: Framingham Baking Co. to close after 109 years in business
author: Autumn Sloboda
bullets: Framingham Baking Co. is set to close on March 29 after 109 years in business.
Founded by Italian immigrant brothers in 1917, the bakery is known for its 18-square-slice sheet pizzas.
The closure announcement elicited hundreds of customer comments, sharing memories and love for the bakery's offerings.

title: AG Campbell files brief to block termination of protected status for Haitian immigrants
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: AG Andrea Joy Campbell filed a brief urging courts to block the end of TPS for Haitian immigrants.
The brief argues ending TPS would harm the economy and public health and destabilize families in Massachusetts.
Campbell's coalition claims Haitian TPS holders contribute $3.4 billion to the U.S. economy annually.

title: City councilor asks police to investigate group of bikers seen in Chinatown
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: City Councilor Ed Flynn requests police investigation after group rides through Chinatown and Leather District on motorized vehicles.
Boston police observed large group near Boston Common, including bikes and motorcycles, but no report filed yet.
Flynn, focusing on pedestrian safety, recently introduced ordinance to regulate high-speed e-bikes in Boston.

title: Ernie Adams named interim football coach at Phillips Andover
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Ernie Adams named interim varsity football coach at Phillips Andover, replacing Trey Brown who had a 2-7 record in 2025.
Adams, 72, was Bill Belichick's classmate and a former confidant, and this is his first head coaching role.
Adams began coaching part-time at Phillips Andover after retiring from the Patriots in 2021.

title: 2 ‘storybook escapes’ for 2026 are in New England, according to HomeToGo
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Woodstock, Vermont and Bar Harbor, Maine are ranked as top 'storybook escapes' for 2026 by HomeToGo.
Woodstock, Vermont sees a 105% increase in searches with a median nightly cost of $153 per person.
Bar Harbor, Maine experiences a 39% search increase with a median nightly cost of $174 per person.

title: Patriots reportedly set to name Zak Kuhr as defensive coordinator
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Zak Kuhr is set to be officially named the New England Patriots' defensive coordinator for the 2026 season.
Kuhr stepped into the interim defensive coordinator role in 2025 after Terrell Williams battled prostate cancer.
Vinny DePalma will take over Kuhr's former position as inside linebackers coach for the Patriots.

title: This music teacher is running the Boston Marathon for Parkinson’s research
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Owen Hughes Jr., a music teacher from White Plains, NY, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon.
Hughes is participating to raise funds for The Michael J. Fox Foundation for Parkinson's Research, honoring his father.
It will be Hughes' ninth marathon since he began running in 2022, emphasizing personal and familial significance.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 18)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington saw the sale of a Colonial at 840 Hancock St. for $705,000 on a 100,169-square-foot lot.
Andover's largest recent sale was a one-family Colonial at 7 Germano Way for $1,200,000.
A Boston row-middle at 32 W Cedar St. sold for $4,800,000, the highest in the area.

title: Cardi B appears to confirm Stefon Diggs split at L.A. concert
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Cardi B hinted at a split from Patriots' Stefon Diggs during her L.A concert, mentioning she's not involved with her 'baby daddy'.
Cardi B and Stefon Diggs were rumored to have broken up after unfollowing each other on Instagram post-Super Bowl loss.
Stefon Diggs faces battery and strangulation charges after an alleged incident with a private chef; a pre-trial hearing is scheduled for April 1.
